intro: Cistus × merinoi, commonly known as the Merino rockrose, is a hybrid shrub native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the genus Cistus, which is part of the family Rubiaceae, and is characterized by its aromatic evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well-suited for Mediterranean climates. The leaves are leathery and contain essential oils, contributing to its distinctive scent and ecological significance.
